 33 /*global JXG: true, define: true*/
 34 /*jslint nomen: true, plusplus: true*/

 36 /* depends:

 51 /**
 52  * @fileoverview In this file the geometry element Curve is defined.
 53  */
 54 
 55 define([
 56     'jxg', 'base/constants', 'base/coords', 'base/element', 'math/math', 'math/statistics', 'math/numerics',
 57     'math/geometry', 'parser/geonext', 'utils/type', 'base/transformation', 'math/qdt'
 58 ], function (JXG, Const, Coords, GeometryElement, Mat, Statistics, Numerics, Geometry, GeonextParser, Type, Transform, QDT) {
 59 
 60     "use strict";
 61 
 62     /**
 63      * Curves are the common object for function graphs, parametric curves, polar curves, and data plots.
 64      * @class Creates a new curve object. Do not use this constructor to create a curve. Use {@link JXG.Board#create} with
 65      * type {@link Curve}, or {@link Functiongraph} instead.
 66      * @augments JXG.GeometryElement
 67      * @param {String|JXG.Board} board The board the new curve is drawn on.
 68      * @param {Array} parents defining terms An array with the functon terms or the data points of the curve.
 69      * @param {Object} attributes Defines the visual appearance of the curve.
 70      * @see JXG.Board#generateName
 71      * @see JXG.Board#addCurve
 72      */
 73     JXG.Curve = function (board, parents, attributes) {
 74         this.constructor(board, attributes, Const.OBJECT_TYPE_CURVE, Const.OBJECT_CLASS_CURVE);
 75 
 76         this.points = [];
 77         /**
 78          * Number of points on curves. This value changes
 79          * between numberPointsLow and numberPointsHigh.
 80          * It is set in {@link JXG.Curve#updateCurve}.
 81          */
 82         this.numberPoints = Type.evaluate(this.visProp.numberpointshigh);
 83 
 84         this.bezierDegree = 1;
 85 
 86         /**
 87          * Array holding the x-coordinates of a data plot.
 88          * This array can be updated during run time by overwriting
 89          * the method {@link JXG.Curve#updateDataArray}.
 90          * @type {array}
 91          */
 92         this.dataX = null;
 93 
 94         /**
 95          * Array holding the y-coordinates of a data plot.
 96          * This array can be updated during run time by overwriting
 97          * the method {@link JXG.Curve#updateDataArray}.
 98          * @type {array}
 99          */
100         this.dataY = null;
101 
102         /**
103          * Stores a quad tree if it is required. The quad tree is generated in the curve
104          * updates and can be used to speed up the hasPoint method.
105          * @type {JXG.Math.Quadtree}
106          */
107         this.qdt = null;
108 
109         if (Type.exists(parents[0])) {
110             this.varname = parents[0];
111         } else {
112             this.varname = 'x';
113         }
114 
115         // function graphs: "x"
116         this.xterm = parents[1];
117         // function graphs: e.g. "x^2"
118         this.yterm = parents[2];
119 
120         // Converts GEONExT syntax into JavaScript syntax
121         this.generateTerm(this.varname, this.xterm, this.yterm, parents[3], parents[4]);
122         // First evaluation of the curve
123         this.updateCurve();
124 
125         this.id = this.board.setId(this, 'G');
126         this.board.renderer.drawCurve(this);
127 
128         this.board.finalizeAdding(this);
129 
130         this.createGradient();
131         this.elType = 'curve';
132         this.createLabel();
133 
134         if (Type.isString(this.xterm)) {
135             this.notifyParents(this.xterm);
136         }
137         if (Type.isString(this.yterm)) {
138             this.notifyParents(this.yterm);
139         }
140 
141         this.methodMap = Type.deepCopy(this.methodMap, {
142             generateTerm: 'generateTerm',
143             setTerm: 'generateTerm',
144             move: 'moveTo',
145             moveTo: 'moveTo'
146         });
147     };
148 
149     JXG.Curve.prototype = new GeometryElement();
150 
151     JXG.extend(JXG.Curve.prototype, /** @lends JXG.Curve.prototype */ {
152 
153         /**
154          * Gives the default value of the left bound for the curve.
155          * May be overwritten in {@link JXG.Curve#generateTerm}.
156          * @returns {Number} Left bound for the curve.
157          */
158         minX: function () {
159             var leftCoords;
160 
161             if (Type.evaluate(this.visProp.curvetype) === 'polar') {
162                 return 0;
163             }
164 
165             leftCoords = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_SCREEN, [0, 0], this.board, false);
166             return leftCoords.usrCoords[1];
167         },
168 
169         /**
170          * Gives the default value of the right bound for the curve.
171          * May be overwritten in {@link JXG.Curve#generateTerm}.
172          * @returns {Number} Right bound for the curve.
173          */
174         maxX: function () {
175             var rightCoords;
176 
177             if (Type.evaluate(this.visProp.curvetype) === 'polar') {
178                 return 2 * Math.PI;
179             }
180             rightCoords = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_SCREEN, [this.board.canvasWidth, 0], this.board, false);
181 
182             return rightCoords.usrCoords[1];
183         },
184 
185         /**
186          * The parametric function which defines the x-coordinate of the curve.
187          * @param {Number} t A number between {@link JXG.Curve#minX} and {@link JXG.Curve#maxX}.
188          * @param {Boolean} suspendUpdate A boolean flag which is false for the
189          * first call of the function during a fresh plot of the curve and true
190          * for all subsequent calls of the function. This may be used to speed up the
191          * plotting of the curve, if the e.g. the curve depends on some input elements.
192          * @returns {Number} x-coordinate of the curve at t.
193          */
194         X: function (t) {
195             return NaN;
196         },
197 
198         /**
199         * The parametric function which defines the y-coordinate of the curve.
200         * @param {Number} t A number between {@link JXG.Curve#minX} and {@link JXG.Curve#maxX}.
201         * @param {Boolean} suspendUpdate A boolean flag which is false for the
202         * first call of the function during a fresh plot of the curve and true
203         * for all subsequent calls of the function. This may be used to speed up the
204         * plotting of the curve, if the e.g. the curve depends on some input elements.
205         * @returns {Number} y-coordinate of the curve at t.
206          */
207         Y: function (t) {
208             return NaN;
209         },
210 
211         /**
212          * Treat the curve as curve with homogeneous coordinates.
213          * @param {Number} t A number between {@link JXG.Curve#minX} and {@link JXG.Curve#maxX}.
214          * @returns {Number} Always 1.0
215          */
216         Z: function (t) {
217             return 1;
218         },
219 
220         /**
221          * Checks whether (x,y) is near the curve.
222          * @param {Number} x Coordinate in x direction, screen coordinates.
223          * @param {Number} y Coordinate in y direction, screen coordinates.
224          * @param {Number} start Optional start index for search on data plots.
225          * @returns {Boolean} True if (x,y) is near the curve, False otherwise.
226          */
227         hasPoint: function (x, y, start) {
228             var t, checkPoint, len, invMat, c,
229                 i, tX, tY,
230                 res = [],
231                 points, qdt,
232                 steps = Type.evaluate(this.visProp.numberpointslow),
233                 d = (this.maxX() - this.minX()) / steps,
234                 prec = this.board.options.precision.hasPoint,
235                 dist = Infinity,
236                 ux2, uy2,
237                 ev_ct,
238                 mi, ma,
239                 suspendUpdate = true;
240 
241             checkPoint = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_SCREEN, [x, y], this.board, false);
242             x = checkPoint.usrCoords[1];
243             y = checkPoint.usrCoords[2];
244 
245             // We use usrCoords. Only in the final distance calculation
246             // screen coords are used
247             prec += Type.evaluate(this.visProp.strokewidth) * 0.5;
248             prec *= prec; // We do not want to take sqrt
249             ux2 = this.board.unitX * this.board.unitX;
250             uy2 = this.board.unitY * this.board.unitY;
251 
252             mi = this.minX();
253             ma = this.maxX();
254             if (Type.exists(this._visibleArea)) {
255                 mi = this._visibleArea[0];
256                 ma = this._visibleArea[1];
257                 d = (ma - mi) / steps;
258             }
259 
260             ev_ct = Type.evaluate(this.visProp.curvetype);
261             if (ev_ct === 'parameter' || ev_ct === 'polar') {
262                 if (this.transformations.length > 0) {
263                     /**
264                      * Transform the mouse/touch coordinates
265                      * back to the original position of the curve.
266                      */
267                     this.updateTransformMatrix();
268                     invMat = Mat.inverse(this.transformMat);
269                     c = Mat.matVecMult(invMat, [1, x, y]);
270                     x = c[1];
271                     y = c[2];
272                 }
273 
274                 // Brute force search for a point on the curve close to the mouse pointer
275                 for (i = 0, t = mi; i < steps; i++) {
276                     tX = this.X(t, suspendUpdate);
277                     tY = this.Y(t, suspendUpdate);
278 
279                     dist = (x - tX) * (x - tX) * ux2 + (y - tY) * (y - tY) * uy2;
280 
281                     if (dist <= prec) {
282                         return true;
283                     }
284 
285                     t += d;
286                 }
287             } else if (ev_ct === 'plot' ||
288                         ev_ct === 'functiongraph') {
289 
290                 if (!Type.exists(start) || start < 0) {
291                     start = 0;
292                 }
293 
294                 if (Type.exists(this.qdt) &&
295                     Type.evaluate(this.visProp.useqdt) &&
296                     this.bezierDegree !== 3
297                     ) {
298                     qdt = this.qdt.query(new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [x, y], this.board));
299                     points = qdt.points;
300                     len = points.length;
301                 } else {
302                     points = this.points;
303                     len = this.numberPoints - 1;
304                 }
305 
306                 for (i = start; i < len; i++) {
307                     if (this.bezierDegree === 3) {
308                         res.push(Geometry.projectCoordsToBeziersegment([1, x, y], this, i));
309                     } else {
310                         if (qdt) {
311                             if (points[i].prev) {
312                                 res = Geometry.projectCoordsToSegment(
313                                     [1, x, y],
314                                     points[i].prev.usrCoords,
315                                     points[i].usrCoords
316                                 );
317                             }
318 
319                             // If the next point in the array is the same as the current points
320                             // next neighbor we don't have to project it onto that segment because
321                             // that will already be done in the next iteration of this loop.
322                             if (points[i].next && points[i + 1] !== points[i].next) {
323                                 res = Geometry.projectCoordsToSegment(
324                                     [1, x, y],
325                                     points[i].usrCoords,
326                                     points[i].next.usrCoords
327                                 );
328                             }
329                         } else {
330                             res = Geometry.projectCoordsToSegment(
331                                 [1, x, y],
332                                 points[i].usrCoords,
333                                 points[i + 1].usrCoords
334                             );
335                         }
336                     }
337 
338                     if (res[1] >= 0 && res[1] <= 1 &&
339                         (x - res[0][1]) * (x - res[0][1]) * ux2 +
340                         (y - res[0][2]) * (y - res[0][2]) * uy2 <= prec) {
341                         return true;
342                     }
343                 }
344                 return false;
345             }
346             return (dist < prec);
347         },
348 
349         /**
350          * Allocate points in the Coords array this.points
351          */
352         allocatePoints: function () {
353             var i, len;
354 
355             len = this.numberPoints;
356 
357             if (this.points.length < this.numberPoints) {
358                 for (i = this.points.length; i < len; i++) {
359                     this.points[i] = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [0, 0], this.board, false);
360                 }
361             }
362         },
363 
364         /**
365          * Computes for equidistant points on the x-axis the values of the function
366          * @returns {JXG.Curve} Reference to the curve object.
367          * @see JXG.Curve#updateCurve
368          */
369         update: function () {
370             if (this.needsUpdate) {
371                 if (Type.evaluate(this.visProp.trace)) {
372                     this.cloneToBackground(true);
373                 }
374                 this.updateCurve();
375             }
376 
377             return this;
378         },
379 
380         /**
381          * Updates the visual contents of the curve.
382          * @returns {JXG.Curve} Reference to the curve object.
383          */
384         updateRenderer: function () {
385             //var wasReal;
386 
387             if (!this.needsUpdate) {
388                 return this;
389             }
390 
391             if (this.visPropCalc.visible) {
392                 // wasReal = this.isReal;
393 
394                 this.checkReal();
395 
396                 if (//wasReal &&
397                     !this.isReal) {
398                     this.updateVisibility(false);
399                 }
400             }
401 
402             if (this.visPropCalc.visible) {
403                 this.board.renderer.updateCurve(this);
404             }
405 
406             /* Update the label if visible. */
407             if (this.hasLabel && this.visPropCalc.visible && this.label &&
408                 this.label.visPropCalc.visible && this.isReal) {
409 
410                 this.label.update();
411                 this.board.renderer.updateText(this.label);
412             }
413 
414             // Update rendNode display
415             this.setDisplayRendNode();
416             // if (this.visPropCalc.visible !== this.visPropOld.visible) {
417             //     this.board.renderer.display(this, this.visPropCalc.visible);
418             //     this.visPropOld.visible = this.visPropCalc.visible;
419             //
420             //     if (this.hasLabel) {
421             //         this.board.renderer.display(this.label, this.label.visPropCalc.visible);
422             //     }
423             // }
424 
425             this.needsUpdate = false;
426             return this;
427         },
428 
429         /**
430          * For dynamic dataplots updateCurve can be used to compute new entries
431          * for the arrays {@link JXG.Curve#dataX} and {@link JXG.Curve#dataY}. It
432          * is used in {@link JXG.Curve#updateCurve}. Default is an empty method, can
433          * be overwritten by the user.
434          *
435          *
436          * @example
437          * // This example overwrites the updateDataArray method.
438          * // There, new values for the arrays JXG.Curve.dataX and JXG.Curve.dataY
439          * // are computed from the value of the slider N
440          *
441          * var N = board.create('slider', [[0,1.5],[3,1.5],[1,3,40]], {name:'n',snapWidth:1});
442          * var circ = board.create('circle',[[4,-1.5],1],{strokeWidth:1, strokecolor:'black', strokeWidth:2,
443          * 		fillColor:'#0055ff13'});
444          *
445          * var c = board.create('curve', [[0],[0]],{strokecolor:'red', strokeWidth:2});
446          * c.updateDataArray = function() {
447          *         var r = 1, n = Math.floor(N.Value()),
448          *             x = [0], y = [0],
449          *             phi = Math.PI/n,
450          *             h = r*Math.cos(phi),
451          *             s = r*Math.sin(phi),
452          *             i, j,
453          *             px = 0, py = 0, sgn = 1,
454          *             d = 16,
455          *             dt = phi/d,
456          *             pt;
457          *
458          *         for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
459          *             for (j = -d; j <= d; j++) {
460          *                 pt = dt*j;
461          *                 x.push(px + r*Math.sin(pt));
462          *                 y.push(sgn*r*Math.cos(pt) - (sgn-1)*h*0.5);
463          *             }
464          *             px += s;
465          *             sgn *= (-1);
466          *         }
467          *         x.push((n - 1)*s);
468          *         y.push(h + (sgn - 1)*h*0.5);
469          *         this.dataX = x;
470          *         this.dataY = y;
471          *     }
472          *
473          * var c2 = board.create('curve', [[0],[0]],{strokecolor:'red', strokeWidth:1});
474          * c2.updateDataArray = function() {
475          *         var r = 1, n = Math.floor(N.Value()),
476          *             px = circ.midpoint.X(), py = circ.midpoint.Y(),
477          *             x = [px], y = [py],
478          *             phi = Math.PI/n,
479          *             s = r*Math.sin(phi),
480          *             i, j,
481          *             d = 16,
482          *             dt = phi/d,
483          *             pt = Math.PI*0.5+phi;
484          *
485          *         for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
486          *             for (j= -d; j <= d; j++) {
487          *                 x.push(px + r*Math.cos(pt));
488          *                 y.push(py + r*Math.sin(pt));
489          *                 pt -= dt;
490          *             }
491          *             x.push(px);
492          *             y.push(py);
493          *             pt += dt;
494          *         }
495          *         this.dataX = x;
496          *         this.dataY = y;
497          *     }
498          *     board.update();
499          *
500          * </pre><div id="JXG20bc7802-e69e-11e5-b1bf-901b0e1b8723" class="jxgbox" style="width: 600px; height: 400px;"></div>
501          * <script type="text/javascript">
502          *     (function() {
503          *         var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('JXG20bc7802-e69e-11e5-b1bf-901b0e1b8723',
504          *             {boundingbox: [-1.5,2,8,-3], keepaspectratio: true, axis: true, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false});
505          *             var N = board.create('slider', [[0,1.5],[3,1.5],[1,3,40]], {name:'n',snapWidth:1});
506          *             var circ = board.create('circle',[[4,-1.5],1],{strokeWidth:1, strokecolor:'black',
507          *             strokeWidth:2, fillColor:'#0055ff13'});
508          *
509          *             var c = board.create('curve', [[0],[0]],{strokecolor:'red', strokeWidth:2});
510          *             c.updateDataArray = function() {
511          *                     var r = 1, n = Math.floor(N.Value()),
512          *                         x = [0], y = [0],
513          *                         phi = Math.PI/n,
514          *                         h = r*Math.cos(phi),
515          *                         s = r*Math.sin(phi),
516          *                         i, j,
517          *                         px = 0, py = 0, sgn = 1,
518          *                         d = 16,
519          *                         dt = phi/d,
520          *                         pt;
521          *
522          *                     for (i=0;i<n;i++) {
523          *                         for (j=-d;j<=d;j++) {
524          *                             pt = dt*j;
525          *                             x.push(px+r*Math.sin(pt));
526          *                             y.push(sgn*r*Math.cos(pt)-(sgn-1)*h*0.5);
527          *                         }
528          *                         px += s;
529          *                         sgn *= (-1);
530          *                     }
531          *                     x.push((n-1)*s);
532          *                     y.push(h+(sgn-1)*h*0.5);
533          *                     this.dataX = x;
534          *                     this.dataY = y;
535          *                 }
536          *
537          *             var c2 = board.create('curve', [[0],[0]],{strokecolor:'red', strokeWidth:1});
538          *             c2.updateDataArray = function() {
539          *                     var r = 1, n = Math.floor(N.Value()),
540          *                         px = circ.midpoint.X(), py = circ.midpoint.Y(),
541          *                         x = [px], y = [py],
542          *                         phi = Math.PI/n,
543          *                         s = r*Math.sin(phi),
544          *                         i, j,
545          *                         d = 16,
546          *                         dt = phi/d,
547          *                         pt = Math.PI*0.5+phi;
548          *
549          *                     for (i=0;i<n;i++) {
550          *                         for (j=-d;j<=d;j++) {
551          *                             x.push(px+r*Math.cos(pt));
552          *                             y.push(py+r*Math.sin(pt));
553          *                             pt -= dt;
554          *                         }
555          *                         x.push(px);
556          *                         y.push(py);
557          *                         pt += dt;
558          *                     }
559          *                     this.dataX = x;
560          *                     this.dataY = y;
561          *                 }
562          *                 board.update();
563          *
564          *     })();
565          *
566          * </script><pre>
567          *
568          * @example
569          * // This is an example which overwrites updateDataArray and produces
570          * // a Bezier curve of degree three.
571          * var A = board.create('point', [-3,3]);
572          * var B = board.create('point', [3,-2]);
573          * var line = board.create('segment', [A,B]);
574          *
575          * var height = 0.5; // height of the curly brace
576          *
577          * // Curly brace
578          * var crl = board.create('curve', [[0],[0]], {strokeWidth:1, strokeColor:'black'});
579          * crl.bezierDegree = 3;
580          * crl.updateDataArray = function() {
581          *     var d = [B.X()-A.X(), B.Y()-A.Y()],
582          *         dl = Math.sqrt(d[0]*d[0]+d[1]*d[1]),
583          *         mid = [(A.X()+B.X())*0.5, (A.Y()+B.Y())*0.5];
584          *
585          *     d[0] *= height/dl;
586          *     d[1] *= height/dl;
587          *
588          *     this.dataX = [ A.X(), A.X()-d[1], mid[0], mid[0]-d[1], mid[0], B.X()-d[1], B.X() ];
589          *     this.dataY = [ A.Y(), A.Y()+d[0], mid[1], mid[1]+d[0], mid[1], B.Y()+d[0], B.Y() ];
590          * };
591          *
592          * // Text
593          * var txt = board.create('text', [
594          *                     function() {
595          *                         var d = [B.X()-A.X(), B.Y()-A.Y()],
596          *                             dl = Math.sqrt(d[0]*d[0]+d[1]*d[1]),
597          *                             mid = (A.X()+B.X())*0.5;
598          *
599          *                         d[1] *= height/dl;
600          *                         return mid-d[1]+0.1;
601          *                     },
602          *                     function() {
603          *                         var d = [B.X()-A.X(), B.Y()-A.Y()],
604          *                             dl = Math.sqrt(d[0]*d[0]+d[1]*d[1]),
605          *                             mid = (A.Y()+B.Y())*0.5;
606          *
607          *                         d[0] *= height/dl;
608          *                         return mid+d[0]+0.1;
609          *                     },
610          *                     function() { return "length=" + JXG.toFixed(B.Dist(A), 2); }
611          *                 ]);
612          *
613          *
614          * board.update(); // This update is necessary to call updateDataArray the first time.
615          *
616          * </pre><div id="JXGa61a4d66-e69f-11e5-b1bf-901b0e1b8723"  class="jxgbox" style="width: 300px; height: 300px;"></div>
617          * <script type="text/javascript">
618          *     (function() {
619          *      var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('JXGa61a4d66-e69f-11e5-b1bf-901b0e1b8723',
620          *             {boundingbox: [-4, 4, 4,-4], axis: true, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false});
621          *     var A = board.create('point', [-3,3]);
622          *     var B = board.create('point', [3,-2]);
623          *     var line = board.create('segment', [A,B]);
624          *
625          *     var height = 0.5; // height of the curly brace
626          *
627          *     // Curly brace
628          *     var crl = board.create('curve', [[0],[0]], {strokeWidth:1, strokeColor:'black'});
629          *     crl.bezierDegree = 3;
630          *     crl.updateDataArray = function() {
631          *         var d = [B.X()-A.X(), B.Y()-A.Y()],
632          *             dl = Math.sqrt(d[0]*d[0]+d[1]*d[1]),
633          *             mid = [(A.X()+B.X())*0.5, (A.Y()+B.Y())*0.5];
634          *
635          *         d[0] *= height/dl;
636          *         d[1] *= height/dl;
637          *
638          *         this.dataX = [ A.X(), A.X()-d[1], mid[0], mid[0]-d[1], mid[0], B.X()-d[1], B.X() ];
639          *         this.dataY = [ A.Y(), A.Y()+d[0], mid[1], mid[1]+d[0], mid[1], B.Y()+d[0], B.Y() ];
640          *     };
641          *
642          *     // Text
643          *     var txt = board.create('text', [
644          *                         function() {
645          *                             var d = [B.X()-A.X(), B.Y()-A.Y()],
646          *                                 dl = Math.sqrt(d[0]*d[0]+d[1]*d[1]),
647          *                                 mid = (A.X()+B.X())*0.5;
648          *
649          *                             d[1] *= height/dl;
650          *                             return mid-d[1]+0.1;
651          *                         },
652          *                         function() {
653          *                             var d = [B.X()-A.X(), B.Y()-A.Y()],
654          *                                 dl = Math.sqrt(d[0]*d[0]+d[1]*d[1]),
655          *                                 mid = (A.Y()+B.Y())*0.5;
656          *
657          *                             d[0] *= height/dl;
658          *                             return mid+d[0]+0.1;
659          *                         },
660          *                         function() { return "length="+JXG.toFixed(B.Dist(A), 2); }
661          *                     ]);
662          *
663          *
664          *     board.update(); // This update is necessary to call updateDataArray the first time.
665          *
666          *     })();
667          *
668          * </script><pre>
669          *
670          *
671          */
672         updateDataArray: function () {
673             // this used to return this, but we shouldn't rely on the user to implement it.
674         },
675 
676         /**
677          * Computes for equidistant points on the x-axis the values
678          * of the function.
679          * If the mousemove event triggers this update, we use only few
680          * points. Otherwise, e.g. on mouseup, many points are used.
681          * @see JXG.Curve#update
682          * @returns {JXG.Curve} Reference to the curve object.
683          */
684         updateCurve: function () {
685             var len, mi, ma, x, y, i,
686                 //t1, t2, l1,
687                 suspendUpdate = false;
688 
689             this.updateTransformMatrix();
690             this.updateDataArray();
691             mi = this.minX();
692             ma = this.maxX();
693 
694             // Discrete data points
695             // x-coordinates are in an array
696             if (Type.exists(this.dataX)) {
697                 this.numberPoints = this.dataX.length;
698                 len = this.numberPoints;
699 
700                 // It is possible, that the array length has increased.
701                 this.allocatePoints();
702 
703                 for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
704                     x = i;
705 
706                     // y-coordinates are in an array
707                     if (Type.exists(this.dataY)) {
708                         y = i;
709                         // The last parameter prevents rounding in usr2screen().
710                         this.points[i].setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [this.dataX[i], this.dataY[i]], false);
711                     } else {
712                         // discrete x data, continuous y data
713                         y = this.X(x);
714                         // The last parameter prevents rounding in usr2screen().
715                         this.points[i].setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [this.dataX[i], this.Y(y, suspendUpdate)], false);
716                     }
717                     this.points[i]._t = i;
718 
719                     // this.updateTransform(this.points[i]);
720                     suspendUpdate = true;
721                 }
722             // continuous x data
723             } else {
724                 if (Type.evaluate(this.visProp.doadvancedplot)) {
725                     this.updateParametricCurve(mi, ma);
726                 } else if (Type.evaluate(this.visProp.doadvancedplotold)) {
727                     this.updateParametricCurveOld(mi, ma);
728                 } else {
729                     if (this.board.updateQuality === this.board.BOARD_QUALITY_HIGH) {
730                         this.numberPoints = Type.evaluate(this.visProp.numberpointshigh);
731                     } else {
732                         this.numberPoints = Type.evaluate(this.visProp.numberpointslow);
733                     }
734 
735                     // It is possible, that the array length has increased.
736                     this.allocatePoints();
737                     this.updateParametricCurveNaive(mi, ma, this.numberPoints);
738                 }
739                 len = this.numberPoints;
740 
741                 if (Type.evaluate(this.visProp.useqdt) &&
742                     this.board.updateQuality === this.board.BOARD_QUALITY_HIGH) {
743                     this.qdt = new QDT(this.board.getBoundingBox());
744                     for (i = 0; i < this.points.length; i++) {
745                         this.qdt.insert(this.points[i]);
746 
747                         if (i > 0) {
748                             this.points[i].prev = this.points[i - 1];
749                         }
750 
751                         if (i < len - 1) {
752                             this.points[i].next = this.points[i + 1];
753                         }
754                     }
755                 }
756 
757                 // for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
758                 //     this.updateTransform(this.points[i]);
759                 // }
760             }
761 
762             if (Type.evaluate(this.visProp.curvetype) !== 'plot' &&
763                     Type.evaluate(this.visProp.rdpsmoothing)) {
764                 this.points = Numerics.RamerDouglasPeucker(this.points, 0.2);
765                 this.numberPoints = this.points.length;
766             }
767 
768             len = this.numberPoints;
769             for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
770                 this.updateTransform(this.points[i]);
771             }
772 
773             return this;
774         },
775 
776         updateTransformMatrix: function () {
777             var t, i,
778                 len = this.transformations.length;
779 
780             this.transformMat = [[1, 0, 0], [0, 1, 0], [0, 0, 1]];
781 
782             for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
783                 t = this.transformations[i];
784                 t.update();
785                 this.transformMat = Mat.matMatMult(t.matrix, this.transformMat);
786             }
787 
788             return this;
789         },
790 
791         /**
792          * Check if at least one point on the curve is finite and real.
793          **/
794         checkReal: function () {
795             var b = false, i, p,
796                 len = this.numberPoints;
797 
798             for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
799                 p = this.points[i].usrCoords;
800                 if (!isNaN(p[1]) && !isNaN(p[2]) && Math.abs(p[0]) > Mat.eps) {
801                     b = true;
802                     break;
803                 }
804             }
805             this.isReal = b;
806         },
807 
808         /**
809          * Updates the data points of a parametric curve. This version is used if {@link JXG.Curve#doadvancedplot} is <tt>false</tt>.
810          * @param {Number} mi Left bound of curve
811          * @param {Number} ma Right bound of curve
812          * @param {Number} len Number of data points
813          * @returns {JXG.Curve} Reference to the curve object.
814          */
815         updateParametricCurveNaive: function (mi, ma, len) {
816             var i, t,
817                 suspendUpdate = false,
818                 stepSize = (ma - mi) / len;
819 
820             for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
821                 t = mi + i * stepSize;
822                 // The last parameter prevents rounding in usr2screen().
823                 this.points[i].setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [this.X(t, suspendUpdate), this.Y(t, suspendUpdate)], false);
824                 this.points[i]._t = t;
825                 suspendUpdate = true;
826             }
827             return this;
828         },
829 
830         /**
831          * Updates the data points of a parametric curve. This version is used if {@link JXG.Curve#doadvancedplot} is <tt>true</tt>.
832          * Since 0.99 this algorithm is deprecated. It still can be used if {@link JXG.Curve#doadvancedplotold} is <tt>true</tt>.
833          *
834          * @deprecated
835          * @param {Number} mi Left bound of curve
836          * @param {Number} ma Right bound of curve
837          * @returns {JXG.Curve} Reference to the curve object.
838          */
839         updateParametricCurveOld: function (mi, ma) {
840             var i, t, d,
841                 x, y, x0, y0, top, depth,
842                 MAX_DEPTH, MAX_XDIST, MAX_YDIST,
843                 suspendUpdate = false,
844                 po = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [0, 0], this.board, false),
845                 dyadicStack = [],
846                 depthStack = [],
847                 pointStack = [],
848                 divisors = [],
849                 distOK = false,
850                 j = 0,
851                 distFromLine = function (p1, p2, p0) {
852                     var lbda, d,
853                         x0 = p0[1] - p1[1],
854                         y0 = p0[2] - p1[2],
855                         x1 = p2[0] - p1[1],
856                         y1 = p2[1] - p1[2],
857                         den = x1 * x1 + y1 * y1;
858 
859                     if (den >= Mat.eps) {
860                         lbda = (x0 * x1 + y0 * y1) / den;
861                         if (lbda > 0) {
862                             if (lbda <= 1) {
863                                 x0 -= lbda * x1;
864                                 y0 -= lbda * y1;
865                             // lbda = 1.0;
866                             } else {
867                                 x0 -= x1;
868                                 y0 -= y1;
869                             }
870                         }
871                     }
872                     d = x0 * x0 + y0 * y0;
873                     return Math.sqrt(d);
874                 };
875 
876             JXG.deprecated('Curve.updateParametricCurveOld()');
877 
878             if (this.board.updateQuality === this.board.BOARD_QUALITY_LOW) {
879                 MAX_DEPTH = 15;
880                 MAX_XDIST = 10; // 10
881                 MAX_YDIST = 10; // 10
882             } else {
883                 MAX_DEPTH = 21;
884                 MAX_XDIST = 0.7; // 0.7
885                 MAX_YDIST = 0.7; // 0.7
886             }
887 
888             divisors[0] = ma - mi;
889             for (i = 1; i < MAX_DEPTH; i++) {
890                 divisors[i] = divisors[i - 1] * 0.5;
891             }
892 
893             i = 1;
894             dyadicStack[0] = 1;
895             depthStack[0] = 0;
896 
897             t = mi;
898             po.setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [this.X(t, suspendUpdate), this.Y(t, suspendUpdate)], false);
899 
900             // Now, there was a first call to the functions defining the curve.
901             // Defining elements like sliders have been evaluated.
902             // Therefore, we can set suspendUpdate to false, so that these defining elements
903             // need not be evaluated anymore for the rest of the plotting.
904             suspendUpdate = true;
905             x0 = po.scrCoords[1];
906             y0 = po.scrCoords[2];
907             t0 = t;
908 
909             t = ma;
910             po.setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [this.X(t, suspendUpdate), this.Y(t, suspendUpdate)], false);
911             x = po.scrCoords[1];
912             y = po.scrCoords[2];
913 
914             pointStack[0] = [x, y];
915 
916             top = 1;
917             depth = 0;
918 
919             this.points = [];
920             this.points[j++] = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_SCREEN, [x0, y0], this.board, false);
921 
922             do {
923                 distOK = this.isDistOK(x - x0, y - y0, MAX_XDIST, MAX_YDIST) || this.isSegmentOutside(x0, y0, x, y);
924                 while (depth < MAX_DEPTH && (!distOK || depth < 6) && (depth <= 7 || this.isSegmentDefined(x0, y0, x, y))) {
925                     // We jump out of the loop if
926                     // * depth>=MAX_DEPTH or
927                     // * (depth>=6 and distOK) or
928                     // * (depth>7 and segment is not defined)
929 
930                     dyadicStack[top] = i;
931                     depthStack[top] = depth;
932                     pointStack[top] = [x, y];
933                     top += 1;
934 
935                     i = 2 * i - 1;
936                     // Here, depth is increased and may reach MAX_DEPTH
937                     depth++;
938                     // In that case, t is undefined and we will see a jump in the curve.
939                     t = mi + i * divisors[depth];
940 
941                     po.setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [this.X(t, suspendUpdate), this.Y(t, suspendUpdate)], false, true);
942                     x = po.scrCoords[1];
943                     y = po.scrCoords[2];
944                     distOK = this.isDistOK(x - x0, y - y0, MAX_XDIST, MAX_YDIST) || this.isSegmentOutside(x0, y0, x, y);
945                 }
946 
947                 if (j > 1) {
948                     d = distFromLine(this.points[j - 2].scrCoords, [x, y], this.points[j - 1].scrCoords);
949                     if (d < 0.015) {
950                         j -= 1;
951                     }
952                 }
953 
954                 this.points[j] = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_SCREEN, [x, y], this.board, false);
955                 this.points[j]._t = t;
956                 j += 1;
957 
958                 x0 = x;
959                 y0 = y;
960                 t0 = t;
961 
962                 top -= 1;
963                 x = pointStack[top][0];
964                 y = pointStack[top][1];
965                 depth = depthStack[top] + 1;
966                 i = dyadicStack[top] * 2;
967 
968             } while (top > 0 && j < 500000);
969 
970             this.numberPoints = this.points.length;
971 
972             return this;
973         },
974 
975         /**
976          * Crude and cheap test if the segment defined by the two points <tt>(x0, y0)</tt> and <tt>(x1, y1)</tt> is
977          * outside the viewport of the board. All parameters have to be given in screen coordinates.
978          *
979          * @private
980          * @param {Number} x0
981          * @param {Number} y0
982          * @param {Number} x1
983          * @param {Number} y1
984          * @returns {Boolean} <tt>true</tt> if the given segment is outside the visible area.
985          */
986         isSegmentOutside: function (x0, y0, x1, y1) {
987             return (y0 < 0 && y1 < 0) || (y0 > this.board.canvasHeight && y1 > this.board.canvasHeight) ||
988                 (x0 < 0 && x1 < 0) || (x0 > this.board.canvasWidth && x1 > this.board.canvasWidth);
989         },
990 
991         /**
992          * Compares the absolute value of <tt>dx</tt> with <tt>MAXX</tt> and the absolute value of <tt>dy</tt>
993          * with <tt>MAXY</tt>.
994          *
995          * @private
996          * @param {Number} dx
997          * @param {Number} dy
998          * @param {Number} MAXX
999          * @param {Number} MAXY
1000          * @returns {Boolean} <tt>true</tt>, if <tt>|dx| < MAXX</tt> and <tt>|dy| < MAXY</tt>.
1001          */
1002         isDistOK: function (dx, dy, MAXX, MAXY) {
1003             return (Math.abs(dx) < MAXX && Math.abs(dy) < MAXY) && !isNaN(dx + dy);
1004         },
1005 
1006          /**
1007          * @private
1008          */
1009         isSegmentDefined: function (x0, y0, x1, y1) {
1010             return !(isNaN(x0 + y0) && isNaN(x1 + y1));
1011         },
1012 
1013         /**
1014          * Add a point to the curve plot. If the new point is too close to the previously inserted point,
1015          * it is skipped.
1016          * Used in {@link JXG.Curve._plotRecursive}.
1017          *
1018          * @private
1019          * @param {JXG.Coords} pnt Coords to add to the list of points
1020          */
1021         _insertPoint: function (pnt, t) {
1022             var lastReal = !isNaN(this._lastCrds[1] + this._lastCrds[2]),     // The last point was real
1023                 newReal = !isNaN(pnt.scrCoords[1] + pnt.scrCoords[2]),        // New point is real point
1024                 cw = this.board.canvasWidth,
1025                 ch = this.board.canvasHeight,
1026                 off = 500;
1027 
1028             newReal = newReal &&
1029                         (pnt.scrCoords[1] > -off && pnt.scrCoords[2] > -off &&
1030                          pnt.scrCoords[1] < cw + off && pnt.scrCoords[2] < ch + off);
1031 
1032             /*
1033              * Prevents two consecutive NaNs or points wich are too close
1034              */
1035             if ((!newReal && lastReal) ||
1036                     (newReal && (!lastReal ||
1037                         Math.abs(pnt.scrCoords[1] - this._lastCrds[1]) > 0.7 ||
1038                         Math.abs(pnt.scrCoords[2] - this._lastCrds[2]) > 0.7))) {
1039                 pnt._t = t;
1040                 this.points.push(pnt);
1041                 this._lastCrds = pnt.copy('scrCoords');
1042             }
1043         },
1044 
1045         /**
1046          * Find the intersection of the asymptote for e.g. a log function
1047          * with the canvas.
1048          * @private
1049          * @param  {Array} asymptote Asymptote line in standard form
1050          * @param  {Array} box       Bounding box of the canavs
1051          * @param  {Number} direction horizontal direction of the asymptote. If < 0 the asymptote
1052          *  goes to the left, otherwise to the right.
1053          * @returns {Array}           Homogeneous coordinate array of the intersection point.
1054          */
1055         _intersectWithBorder: function(asymptote, box, direction) {
1056             var border, intersection, x, y;
1057 
1058             if (direction <= 0) { // Intersect with left border
1059                 border = [-box[0], 1, 0];
1060                 intersection = Mat.crossProduct(border, asymptote);
1061                 if (intersection[0] !== 0.0) {
1062                     x = intersection[1] / intersection[0];
1063                     y = intersection[2] / intersection[0];
1064                 } else {
1065                     y = Infinity;
1066                 }
1067 
1068                 if (y < box[3]) { // Intersect with bottom border
1069                     border = [-box[3], 0, 1];
1070                     intersection = Mat.crossProduct(border, asymptote);
1071                     if (intersection[0] !== 0.0) {
1072                         x = intersection[1] / intersection[0];
1073                         y = intersection[2] / intersection[0];
1074                     } else {
1075                         x = Infinity;
1076                     }
1077                 } else if (y > box[1]) { // Intersect with top border
1078                     border = [-box[1], 0, 1];
1079                     intersection = Mat.crossProduct(border, asymptote);
1080                     if (intersection[0] !== 0.0) {
1081                         x = intersection[1] / intersection[0];
1082                         y = intersection[2] / intersection[0];
1083                     } else {
1084                         x = Infinity;
1085                     }
1086                 }
1087             } else { // Intersect with right border
1088                 border = [-box[2], 1, 0];
1089                 intersection = Mat.crossProduct(border, asymptote);
1090                 if (intersection[0] !== 0.0) {
1091                     x = intersection[1] / intersection[0];
1092                     y = intersection[2] / intersection[0];
1093                 } else {
1094                     y = Infinity;
1095                 }
1096 
1097                 if (y < box[3]) { // Intersect with bottom border
1098                     border = [-box[3], 0, 1];
1099                     intersection = Mat.crossProduct(border, asymptote);
1100                     if (intersection[0] !== 0.0) {
1101                         x = intersection[1] / intersection[0];
1102                         y = intersection[2] / intersection[0];
1103                     } else {
1104                         x = Infinity;
1105                     }
1106                 } else if (y > box[1]) { // Intersect with top border
1107                     border = [-box[1], 0, 1];
1108                     intersection = Mat.crossProduct(border, asymptote);
1109                     if (intersection[0] !== 0.0) {
1110                         x = intersection[1] / intersection[0];
1111                         y = intersection[2] / intersection[0];
1112                     } else {
1113                         x = Infinity;
1114                     }
1115                 }
1116             }
1117             return [1, x, y];
1118         },
1119 
1120         /**
1121          * Investigate a function term at the bounds of intervals where
1122          * the function is not defined, e.g. log(x) at x = 0.
1123          *
1124          * c is inbetween a and b
1125          * @private
1126          * @param {Array} a Screen coordinates of the left interval bound
1127          * @param {Array} b Screen coordinates of the right interval bound
1128          * @param {Array} c Screen coordinates of the bisection point at (ta + tb) / 2
1129          * @param {Number} ta Parameter which evaluates to a, i.e. [1, X(ta), Y(ta)] = a in screen coordinates
1130          * @param {Number} tb Parameter which evaluates to b, i.e. [1, X(tb), Y(tb)] = b in screen coordinates
1131          * @param {Number} tc (ta + tb) / 2 = tc. Parameter which evaluates to b, i.e. [1, X(tc), Y(tc)] = c in screen coordinates
1132          * @param {Number} depth Actual recursion depth. The recursion stops if depth is equal to 0.
1133          * @returns {JXG.Boolean} true if the point is inserted and the recursion should stop, false otherwise.
1134          */
1135          _borderCase: function (a, b, c, ta, tb, tc, depth) {
1136              var t, pnt, p,
1137                  p_good = null,
1138                  j,
1139                  max_it = 30,
1140                  is_undef = false,
1141                  t_nan, t_real, t_real2,
1142                  box,
1143                  vx, vy, vx2, vy2, dx, dy,
1144                  asymptote;
1145 
1146 
1147              if (depth <= 1) {
1148                 pnt = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [0, 0], this.board, false);
1149                 j = 0;
1150                 // Bisect a, b and c until the point t_real is inside of the definition interval
1151                 // and as close as possible at the boundary.
1152                 // t_real2 is the second closest point.
1153                 do {
1154                     // There are four cases:
1155                     //  a  |  c  |  b
1156                     // ---------------
1157                     // inf | R   | R
1158                     // R   | R   | inf
1159                     // inf | inf | R
1160                     // R   | inf | inf
1161                     //
1162                     if (isNaN(a[1] + a[2]) && !isNaN(c[1] + c[2])) {
1163                         t_nan = ta;
1164                         t_real = tc;
1165                         t_real2 = tb;
1166                     } else if (isNaN(b[1] + b[2]) && !isNaN(c[1] + c[2])) {
1167                         t_nan = tb;
1168                         t_real = tc;
1169                         t_real2 = ta;
1170                     } else if (isNaN(c[1] + c[2]) && !isNaN(b[1] + b[2])) {
1171                         t_nan = tc;
1172                         t_real = tb;
1173                         t_real2 = tb + (tb - tc);
1174                     } else if (isNaN(c[1] + c[2]) && !isNaN(a[1] + a[2])) {
1175                         t_nan = tc;
1176                         t_real = ta;
1177                         t_real2 = ta - (tc - ta);
1178                     } else {
1179                         return false;
1180                     }
1181                     t = 0.5 * (t_nan + t_real);
1182                     pnt.setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [this.X(t, true), this.Y(t, true)], false);
1183                     p = pnt.usrCoords;
1184 
1185                     is_undef = isNaN(p[1] + p[2]);
1186                     if (is_undef) {
1187                         t_nan = t;
1188                     } else {
1189                         t_real2 = t_real;
1190                         t_real = t;
1191                     }
1192                     ++j;
1193                 } while (is_undef && j < max_it);
1194 
1195                 // If bisection was successful, take this point.
1196                 // Usefule only for general curves, for function graph
1197                 // the code below overwrite p_good from here.
1198                 if (j < max_it) {
1199                     p_good = p.slice();
1200                     c = p.slice();
1201                     t_real = t;
1202                 }
1203 
1204                 // OK, bisection has been done now.
1205                 // t_real contains the closest inner point to the border of the interval we could find.
1206                 // t_real2 is the second nearest point to this boundary.
1207                 // Now we approximate the derivative by computing the slope of the line through these two points
1208                 // and test if it is "infinite", i.e larger than 400 in absolute values.
1209                 //
1210                 vx = this.X(t_real, true) ;
1211                 vx2 = this.X(t_real2, true) ;
1212                 dx = (vx - vx2) / (t_real - t_real2);
1213                 vy = this.Y(t_real, true) ;
1214                 vy2 = this.Y(t_real2, true) ;
1215                 dy = (vy - vy2) / (t_real - t_real2);
1216 
1217                 // If the derivatives are large enough we draw the asymptote.
1218                 // box = this.board.getBoundingBox();
1219                 // if (Math.sqrt(dx * dx + dy * dy) > 500.0) {
1220                 //
1221                 //     // The asymptote is a line of the form
1222                 //     //  [c, a, b] = [dx * vy - dy * vx, dy, -dx]
1223                 //     //  Now we have to find the intersection with the correct canvas border.
1224                 //     asymptote = [dx * vy - dy * vx, dy, -dx];
1225                 //
1226                 //     p_good = this._intersectWithBorder(asymptote, box, vx - vx2);
1227                 // }
1228 
1229                 if (p_good !== null) {
1230                     this._insertPoint(new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, p_good, this.board, false));
1231                     return true;
1232                 }
1233             }
1234             return false;
1235         },
1236 
1237         /**
1238          * Compute distances in screen coordinates between the points ab,
1239          * ac, cb, and cd, where d = (a + b)/2.
1240          * cd is used for the smoothness test, ab, ac, cb are used to detect jumps, cusps and poles.
1241          *
1242          * @private
1243          * @param {Array} a Screen coordinates of the left interval bound
1244          * @param {Array} b Screen coordinates of the right interval bound
1245          * @param {Array} c Screen coordinates of the bisection point at (ta + tb) / 2
1246          * @returns {Array} array of distances in screen coordinates between: ab, ac, cb, and cd.
1247          */
1248         _triangleDists: function (a, b, c) {
1249             var d, d_ab, d_ac, d_cb, d_cd;
1250 
1251             d = [a[0] * b[0], (a[1] + b[1]) * 0.5, (a[2] + b[2]) * 0.5];
1252 
1253             d_ab = Geometry.distance(a, b, 3);
1254             d_ac = Geometry.distance(a, c, 3);
1255             d_cb = Geometry.distance(c, b, 3);
1256             d_cd = Geometry.distance(c, d, 3);
1257 
1258             return [d_ab, d_ac, d_cb, d_cd];
1259         },
1260 
1261         /**
1262          * Test if the function is undefined on an interval:
1263          * If the interval borders a and b are undefined, 20 random values
1264          * are tested if they are undefined, too.
1265          * Only if all values are undefined, we declare the function to be undefined in this interval.
1266          *
1267          * @private
1268          * @param {Array} a Screen coordinates of the left interval bound
1269          * @param {Number} ta Parameter which evaluates to a, i.e. [1, X(ta), Y(ta)] = a in screen coordinates
1270          * @param {Array} b Screen coordinates of the right interval bound
1271          * @param {Number} tb Parameter which evaluates to b, i.e. [1, X(tb), Y(tb)] = b in screen coordinates
1272          */
1273         _isUndefined: function (a, ta, b, tb) {
1274             var t, i, pnt;
1275 
1276             if (!isNaN(a[1] + a[2]) || !isNaN(b[1] + b[2])) {
1277                 return false;
1278             }
1279 
1280             pnt = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [0, 0], this.board, false);
1281 
1282             for (i = 0; i < 20; ++i) {
1283                 t = ta + Math.random() * (tb - ta);
1284                 pnt.setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [this.X(t, true), this.Y(t, true)], false);
1285                 if (!isNaN(pnt.scrCoords[0] + pnt.scrCoords[1] + pnt.scrCoords[2])) {
1286                     return false;
1287                 }
1288             }
1289 
1290             return true;
1291         },
1292 
1293         /**
1294          * Decide if a path segment is too far from the canvas that we do not need to draw it.
1295          * @private
1296          * @param  {Array}  a  Screen coordinates of the start point of the segment
1297          * @param  {Array}  ta Curve parameter of a  (unused).
1298          * @param  {Array}  b  Screen coordinates of the end point of the segment
1299          * @param  {Array}  tb Curve parameter of b (unused).
1300          * @returns {Boolean}   True if the segment is too far away from the canvas, false otherwise.
1301          */
1302         _isOutside: function (a, ta, b, tb) {
1303             var off = 500,
1304                 cw = this.board.canvasWidth,
1305                 ch = this.board.canvasHeight;
1306 
1307             return !!((a[1] < -off && b[1] < -off) ||
1308                 (a[2] < -off && b[2] < -off) ||
1309                 (a[1] > cw + off && b[1] > cw + off) ||
1310                 (a[2] > ch + off && b[2] > ch + off));
1311         },
1312 
1313         /**
1314          * Decide if a point of a curve is too far from the canvas that we do not need to draw it.
1315          * @private
1316          * @param  {Array}  a  Screen coordinates of the point
1317          * @returns {Boolean}  True if the point is too far away from the canvas, false otherwise.
1318          */
1319         _isOutsidePoint: function (a) {
1320             var off = 500,
1321                 cw = this.board.canvasWidth,
1322                 ch = this.board.canvasHeight;
1323 
1324             return !!(a[1] < -off ||
1325                       a[2] < -off ||
1326                       a[1] > cw + off ||
1327                       a[2] > ch + off);
1328         },
1329 
1330         /**
1331          * For a curve c(t) defined on the interval [ta, tb] find the first point
1332          * which is in the visible area of the board (plus some outside margin).
1333          * <p>
1334          * This method is necessary to restrict the recursive plotting algorithm
1335          * {@link JXG.Curve._plotRecursive} to the visible area and not waste
1336          * recursion to areas far outside of the visible area.
1337          * <p>
1338          * This method can also be used to find the last visible  point
1339          * by reversing the input parameters.
1340          *
1341          * @param  {Array}  a  Screen coordinates of the start point of the segment
1342          * @param  {Array}  ta Curve parameter of a.
1343          * @param  {Array}  b  Screen coordinates of the end point of the segment (unused)
1344          * @param  {Array}  tb Curve parameter of b
1345          * @return {Array}  Array of length two containing the screen ccordinates of
1346          * the starting point and the curve parameter at this point.
1347          * @private
1348          */
1349         _findStartPoint: function (a, ta, b, tb) {
1350             var i, delta, tc,
1351                 td, z, isFound,
1352                 w2, h2,
1353                 pnt =  new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [0, 0], this.board, false),
1354                 steps = 40,
1355                 eps = 0.01,
1356                 bbox = this.board.getBoundingBox();
1357 
1358             if (!this._isOutsidePoint(a)) {
1359                 return [a, ta];
1360             }
1361 
1362             w2 = (bbox[2] - bbox[0]) * 0.3;
1363             h2 = (bbox[1] - bbox[3]) * 0.3;
1364 
1365             delta = (tb - ta) / steps;
1366             tc = ta + delta;
1367             isFound = false;
1368             //console.log("====================================");
1369             for (i = 0; i < steps; ++i) {
1370                 // Left border
1371                 z = bbox[0] - w2;
1372                 td = Numerics.fzero(function(t) { return this.X(t, true) - z; }, [tc-delta, tc], this);
1373                 // console.log("A", td, Math.abs(this.X(td, true) - z));
1374                 if (Math.abs(this.X(td, true) - z) < eps) { //} * Math.abs(z)) {
1375                     isFound = true;
1376                     break;
1377                 }
1378                 // Top border
1379                 z = bbox[1] + h2;
1380                 td = Numerics.fzero(function(t) { return this.Y(t, true) - z; }, [tc-delta, tc], this);
1381                 // console.log("B", td, Math.abs(this.Y(td, true) - z));
1382                 if (Math.abs(this.Y(td, true) - z) < eps) { // * Math.abs(z)) {
1383                     isFound = true;
1384                     break;
1385                 }
1386                 // Right border
1387                 z = bbox[2] + w2;
1388                 td = Numerics.fzero(function(t) { return this.X(t, true) - z; }, [tc-delta, tc], this);
1389                 // console.log("C", td, Math.abs(this.X(td, true) - z));
1390                 if (Math.abs(this.X(td, true) - z) < eps) { // * Math.abs(z)) {
1391                     isFound = true;
1392                     break;
1393                 }
1394                 // Bottom border
1395                 z = bbox[3] - h2;
1396                 td = Numerics.fzero(function(t) { return this.Y(t, true) - z; }, [tc-delta, tc], this);
1397                 // console.log("D", td, Math.abs(this.Y(td, true) - z));
1398                 if (Math.abs(this.Y(td, true) - z) < eps) { // * Math.abs(z)) {
1399                     isFound = true;
1400                     break;
1401                 }
1402                 // pnt.setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [this.X(tc, true), this.Y(tc, true)], false);
1403                 // //console.log(i, tc, pnt.scrCoords);
1404                 // if (!this._isOutsidePoint(pnt.scrCoords)) {
1405                 //     return [pnt.scrCoords, tc];
1406                 // }
1407                 tc += delta;
1408             }
1409             if (isFound) {
1410                 // console.log("Found in step", i, td);
1411                 pnt.setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [this.X(td, true), this.Y(td, true)], false);
1412                 return [pnt.scrCoords, td];
1413             } else {
1414                 // console.log("not found", ta);
1415             }
1416 
1417             return [a, ta];
1418         },
1419 
1420         /**
1421          * Recursive interval bisection algorithm for curve plotting.
1422          * Used in {@link JXG.Curve.updateParametricCurve}.
1423          * @private
1424          * @param {Array} a Screen coordinates of the left interval bound
1425          * @param {Number} ta Parameter which evaluates to a, i.e. [1, X(ta), Y(ta)] = a in screen coordinates
1426          * @param {Array} b Screen coordinates of the right interval bound
1427          * @param {Number} tb Parameter which evaluates to b, i.e. [1, X(tb), Y(tb)] = b in screen coordinates
1428          * @param {Number} depth Actual recursion depth. The recursion stops if depth is equal to 0.
1429          * @param {Number} delta If the distance of the bisection point at (ta + tb) / 2 from the point (a + b) / 2 is less then delta,
1430          *                 the segment [a,b] is regarded as straight line.
1431          * @returns {JXG.Curve} Reference to the curve object.
1432          */
1433         _plotRecursive: function (a, ta, b, tb, depth, delta) {
1434             var tc, c,
1435                 ds, mindepth = 0,
1436                 isSmooth, isJump, isCusp,
1437                 cusp_threshold = 0.5,
1438                 jump_threshold = 0.99,
1439                 pnt = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [0, 0], this.board, false);
1440 
1441             if (this.numberPoints > 65536) {
1442                 return;
1443             }
1444 
1445             // Test if the function is undefined in an interval
1446             if (depth < this.nanLevel && this._isUndefined(a, ta, b, tb)) {
1447                 return this;
1448             }
1449 
1450             if (depth < this.nanLevel && this._isOutside(a, ta, b, tb)) {
1451                 return this;
1452             }
1453 
1454             tc = (ta  + tb) * 0.5;
1455             pnt.setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [this.X(tc, true), this.Y(tc, true)], false);
1456             c = pnt.scrCoords;
1457 
1458             if (this._borderCase(a, b, c, ta, tb, tc, depth)) {
1459                 return this;
1460             }
1461 
1462             ds = this._triangleDists(a, b, c);           // returns [d_ab, d_ac, d_cb, d_cd]
1463 
1464             isSmooth = (depth < this.smoothLevel) && (ds[3] < delta);
1465 
1466             isJump = (depth < this.jumpLevel) &&
1467                         ((ds[2] > jump_threshold * ds[0]) ||
1468                          (ds[1] > jump_threshold * ds[0]) ||
1469                         ds[0] === Infinity || ds[1] === Infinity || ds[2] === Infinity);
1470 
1471             isCusp = (depth < this.smoothLevel + 2) && (ds[0] < cusp_threshold * (ds[1] + ds[2]));
1472 
1473             if (isCusp) {
1474                 mindepth = 0;
1475                 isSmooth = false;
1476             }
1477 
1478             --depth;
1479 
1480             if (isJump) {
1481                 this._insertPoint(new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_SCREEN, [NaN, NaN], this.board, false), tc);
1482             } else if (depth <= mindepth || isSmooth) {
1483                 this._insertPoint(pnt, tc);
1484                 //if (this._borderCase(a, b, c, ta, tb, tc, depth)) {}
1485             } else {
1486                 this._plotRecursive(a, ta, c, tc, depth, delta);
1487                 this._insertPoint(pnt, tc);
1488                 this._plotRecursive(c, tc, b, tb, depth, delta);
1489             }
1490 
1491             return this;
1492         },
1493 
1494         /**
1495          * Updates the data points of a parametric curve. This version is used if {@link JXG.Curve#doadvancedplot} is <tt>true</tt>.
1496          * @param {Number} mi Left bound of curve
1497          * @param {Number} ma Right bound of curve
1498          * @returns {JXG.Curve} Reference to the curve object.
1499          */
1500         updateParametricCurve: function (mi, ma) {
1501             var ta, tb, a, b,
1502                 suspendUpdate = false,
1503                 pa = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [0, 0], this.board, false),
1504                 pb = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [0, 0], this.board, false),
1505                 depth, delta,
1506                 w2, h2, bbox,
1507                 ret_arr;
1508 
1509             //console.time("plot");
1510             if (this.board.updateQuality === this.board.BOARD_QUALITY_LOW) {
1511                 depth = Type.evaluate(this.visProp.recursiondepthlow) || 13;
1512                 delta = 2;
1513                 // this.smoothLevel = 5; //depth - 7;
1514                 this.smoothLevel = depth - 6;
1515                 this.jumpLevel = 3;
1516             } else {
1517                 depth = Type.evaluate(this.visProp.recursiondepthhigh) || 17;
1518                 delta = 2;
1519                 // smoothLevel has to be small for graphs in a huge interval.
1520                 // this.smoothLevel = 3; //depth - 7; // 9
1521                 this.smoothLevel = depth - 9; // 9
1522                 this.jumpLevel = 2;
1523             }
1524             this.nanLevel = depth - 4;
1525 
1526             this.points = [];
1527 
1528             if (this.xterm === 'x') {
1529                 // For function graphs we can restrict the plot interval
1530                 // to the visible area +plus margin
1531                 bbox = this.board.getBoundingBox();
1532                 w2 = (bbox[2] - bbox[0]) * 0.3;
1533                 h2 = (bbox[1] - bbox[3]) * 0.3;
1534                 ta = Math.max(mi, bbox[0] - w2);
1535                 tb = Math.min(ma, bbox[2] + w2);
1536             } else {
1537                 ta = mi;
1538                 tb = ma;
1539             }
1540             pa.setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [this.X(ta, suspendUpdate), this.Y(ta, suspendUpdate)], false);
1541 
1542             // The first function calls of X() and Y() are done. We can now
1543             // switch `suspendUpdate` on. If supported by the functions, this
1544             // avoids for the rest of the plotting algorithm, evaluation of any
1545             // parent elements.
1546             suspendUpdate = true;
1547 
1548             pb.setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [this.X(tb, suspendUpdate), this.Y(tb, suspendUpdate)], false);
1549 
1550             // Find start and end points of the visible area (plus a certain margin)
1551             ret_arr = this._findStartPoint(pa.scrCoords, ta, pb.scrCoords, tb);
1552             pa.setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_SCREEN, ret_arr[0], false);
1553             ta = ret_arr[1];
1554             ret_arr = this._findStartPoint(pb.scrCoords, tb, pa.scrCoords, ta);
1555             pb.setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_SCREEN, ret_arr[0], false);
1556             tb = ret_arr[1];
1557             // console.log(ta, tb);
1558 
1559             // Save the visible area.
1560             // This can be used in Curve.hasPoint().
1561             this._visibleArea = [ta, tb];
1562 
1563             // Start recursive plotting algorithm
1564             a = pa.copy('scrCoords');
1565             b = pb.copy('scrCoords');
1566             pa._t = ta;
1567             this.points.push(pa);
1568             this._lastCrds = pa.copy('scrCoords');   //Used in _insertPoint
1569             this._plotRecursive(a, ta, b, tb, depth, delta);
1570             pb._t = tb;
1571             this.points.push(pb);
1572 
1573             this.numberPoints = this.points.length;
1574             //console.timeEnd("plot");
1575 
1576             return this;
1577         },
1578 
1579         /**
1580          * Applies the transformations of the curve to the given point <tt>p</tt>.
1581          * Before using it, {@link JXG.Curve#updateTransformMatrix} has to be called.
1582          * @param {JXG.Point} p
1583          * @returns {JXG.Point} The given point.
1584          */
1585         updateTransform: function (p) {
1586             var c,
1587                 len = this.transformations.length;
1588 
1589             if (len > 0) {
1590                 c = Mat.matVecMult(this.transformMat, p.usrCoords);
1591                 p.setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [c[1], c[2]], false, true);
1592             }
1593 
1594             return p;
1595         },
1596 
1597         /**
1598          * Add transformations to this curve.
1599          * @param {JXG.Transformation|Array} transform Either one {@link JXG.Transformation} or an array of {@link JXG.Transformation}s.
1600          * @returns {JXG.Curve} Reference to the curve object.
1601          */
1602         addTransform: function (transform) {
1603             var i,
1604                 list = Type.isArray(transform) ? transform : [transform],
1605                 len = list.length;
1606 
1607             for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
1608                 this.transformations.push(list[i]);
1609             }
1610 
1611             return this;
1612         },
1613 
1614         /**
1615          * Generate the method curve.X() in case curve.dataX is an array
1616          * and generate the method curve.Y() in case curve.dataY is an array.
1617          * @private
1618          * @param {String} which Either 'X' or 'Y'
1619          * @returns {function}
1620          **/
1621         interpolationFunctionFromArray: function (which) {
1622             var data = 'data' + which;
1623 
1624             return function (t, suspendedUpdate) {
1625                 var i, j, t0, t1,
1626                     arr = this[data],
1627                     len = arr.length,
1628                     f = [];
1629 
1630                 if (isNaN(t)) {
1631                     return NaN;
1632                 }
1633 
1634                 if (t < 0) {
1635                     if (Type.isFunction(arr[0])) {
1636                         return arr[0]();
1637                     }
1638 
1639                     return arr[0];
1640                 }
1641 
1642                 if (this.bezierDegree === 3) {
1643                     len /= 3;
1644                     if (t >= len) {
1645                         if (Type.isFunction(arr[arr.length - 1])) {
1646                             return arr[arr.length - 1]();
1647                         }
1648 
1649                         return arr[arr.length - 1];
1650                     }
1651 
1652                     i = Math.floor(t) * 3;
1653                     t0 = t % 1;
1654                     t1 = 1 - t0;
1655 
1656                     for (j = 0; j < 4; j++) {
1657                         if (Type.isFunction(arr[i + j])) {
1658                             f[j] = arr[i + j]();
1659                         } else {
1660                             f[j] = arr[i + j];
1661                         }
1662                     }
1663 
1664                     return t1 * t1 * (t1 * f[0] + 3 * t0 * f[1]) + (3 * t1 * f[2] + t0 * f[3]) * t0 * t0;
1665                 }
1666 
1667                 if (t > len - 2) {
1668                     i = len - 2;
1669                 } else {
1670                     i = parseInt(Math.floor(t), 10);
1671                 }
1672 
1673                 if (i === t) {
1674                     if (Type.isFunction(arr[i])) {
1675                         return arr[i]();
1676                     }
1677                     return arr[i];
1678                 }
1679 
1680                 for (j = 0; j < 2; j++) {
1681                     if (Type.isFunction(arr[i + j])) {
1682                         f[j] = arr[i + j]();
1683                     } else {
1684                         f[j] = arr[i + j];
1685                     }
1686                 }
1687                 return f[0] + (f[1] - f[0]) * (t - i);
1688             };
1689         },
1690 
1691         /**
1692          * Converts the JavaScript/JessieCode/GEONExT syntax of the defining function term into JavaScript.
1693          * New methods X() and Y() for the Curve object are generated, further
1694          * new methods for minX() and maxX().
1695          * @see JXG.GeonextParser.geonext2JS.
1696          */
1697         generateTerm: function (varname, xterm, yterm, mi, ma) {
1698             var fx, fy;
1699 
1700             // Generate the methods X() and Y()
1701             if (Type.isArray(xterm)) {
1702                 // Discrete data
1703                 this.dataX = xterm;
1704 
1705                 this.numberPoints = this.dataX.length;
1706                 this.X = this.interpolationFunctionFromArray('X');
1707                 this.visProp.curvetype = 'plot';
1708                 this.isDraggable = true;
1709             } else {
1710                 // Continuous data
1711                 this.X = Type.createFunction(xterm, this.board, varname);
1712                 if (Type.isString(xterm)) {
1713                     this.visProp.curvetype = 'functiongraph';
1714                 } else if (Type.isFunction(xterm) || Type.isNumber(xterm)) {
1715                     this.visProp.curvetype = 'parameter';
1716                 }
1717 
1718                 this.isDraggable = true;
1719             }
1720 
1721             if (Type.isArray(yterm)) {
1722                 this.dataY = yterm;
1723                 this.Y = this.interpolationFunctionFromArray('Y');
1724             } else {
1725                 this.Y = Type.createFunction(yterm, this.board, varname);
1726             }
1727 
1728             /**
1729              * Polar form
1730              * Input data is function xterm() and offset coordinates yterm
1731              */
1732             if (Type.isFunction(xterm) && Type.isArray(yterm)) {
1733                 // Xoffset, Yoffset
1734                 fx = Type.createFunction(yterm[0], this.board, '');
1735                 fy = Type.createFunction(yterm[1], this.board, '');
1736 
1737                 this.X = function (phi) {
1738                     return xterm(phi) * Math.cos(phi) + fx();
1739                 };
1740 
1741                 this.Y = function (phi) {
1742                     return xterm(phi) * Math.sin(phi) + fy();
1743                 };
1744 
1745                 this.visProp.curvetype = 'polar';
1746             }
1747 
1748             // Set the bounds lower bound
1749             if (Type.exists(mi)) {
1750                 this.minX = Type.createFunction(mi, this.board, '');
1751             }
1752             if (Type.exists(ma)) {
1753                 this.maxX = Type.createFunction(ma, this.board, '');
1754             }
1755         },
1756 
1757         /**
1758          * Finds dependencies in a given term and notifies the parents by adding the
1759          * dependent object to the found objects child elements.
1760          * @param {String} contentStr String containing dependencies for the given object.
1761          */
1762         notifyParents: function (contentStr) {
1763             var fstr, dep,
1764                 isJessieCode = false,
1765                 obj;
1766 
1767             // Read dependencies found by the JessieCode parser
1768             obj = {'xterm': 1, 'yterm': 1};
1769             for (fstr in obj) {
1770                 if (obj.hasOwnProperty(fstr) && this.hasOwnProperty(fstr) && this[fstr].origin) {
1771                     isJessieCode = true;
1772                     for (dep in this[fstr].origin.deps) {
1773                         if (this[fstr].origin.deps.hasOwnProperty(dep)) {
1774                             this[fstr].origin.deps[dep].addChild(this);
1775                         }
1776                     }
1777                 }
1778             }
1779 
1780             if (!isJessieCode) {
1781                 GeonextParser.findDependencies(this, contentStr, this.board);
1782             }
1783         },
1784 
1785         // documented in geometry element
1786         getLabelAnchor: function () {
1787             var c, x, y,
1788                 ax = 0.05 * this.board.canvasWidth,
1789                 ay = 0.05 * this.board.canvasHeight,
1790                 bx = 0.95 * this.board.canvasWidth,
1791                 by = 0.95 * this.board.canvasHeight;
1792 
1793             switch (Type.evaluate(this.visProp.label.position)) {
1794             case 'ulft':
1795                 x = ax;
1796                 y = ay;
1797                 break;
1798             case 'llft':
1799                 x = ax;
1800                 y = by;
1801                 break;
1802             case 'rt':
1803                 x = bx;
1804                 y = 0.5 * by;
1805                 break;
1806             case 'lrt':
1807                 x = bx;
1808                 y = by;
1809                 break;
1810             case 'urt':
1811                 x = bx;
1812                 y = ay;
1813                 break;
1814             case 'top':
1815                 x = 0.5 * bx;
1816                 y = ay;
1817                 break;
1818             case 'bot':
1819                 x = 0.5 * bx;
1820                 y = by;
1821                 break;
1822             default:
1823                 // includes case 'lft'
1824                 x = ax;
1825                 y = 0.5 * by;
1826             }
1827 
1828             c = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_SCREEN, [x, y], this.board, false);
